JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE , LOC .

CARDINAL . The applicant and her husband were involved in a number of real estate transactions . On DATE the applicant 's husband presented her with a flat in PERSON of LOC which she subsequently exchanged for another flat in a different locality .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant became involved in the dispute challenging the CARDINAL - way real estate exchange transactions through the claims brought by the other parties to the transactions .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of LOC ( “ the ORG ” ) annulled the transactions concerning the applicant and her husband . The parties did not appeal , and the judgment came into force .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE CARDINAL other trial courts of the region adopted further judgments related to the same dispute . The parties did not inform ORG content of those judgments .
CARDINAL . On DATE , at the applicant 's request , the deputy president of ORG of GPE brought an extraordinary appeal against the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE granted the appeal , quashed the impugned judgment and remitted the case for fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Presidium of ORG suggested that the ORG review the judgments of DATE and DATE on account of newly discovered circumstances .
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE and DATE ORG explained to the applicant that it was necessary to file a request for review of the impugned judgments on account of newly discovered circumstances .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed such a request with ORG , at the same time claiming invalidation of CARDINAL exchange transactions , involving her husband and third parties LOC and PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to quash the judgment of DATE on account of newly discovered circumstances .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE ORG scheduled CARDINAL hearings . CARDINAL of them did not take place due to the parties ' failure to appear . According to the Government , on DATE ORG “ made certain arrangements to ensure the parties ' appearance for the next hearing ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG annulled all the real estate exchange transactions between the parties to the dispute . The court found it lawful to examine the case and adopt the judgment in absence of CARDINAL of the respondents PERSON . who had been notified of court hearings on multiple occasions .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) set aside the above judgment on appeal for errors in application of the procedural law , including insufficient measures to ensure PERSON . 's appearance in court , and ordered a new hearing .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings until DATE a counter - terrorist operation in GPE of GPE , where one of the disputed flats was located . The proceedings were resumed on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court postponed the hearing due to some of the parties ' failure to appear , having again “ made certain arrangements to ensure their appearance for the next hearing ” .
CARDINAL . On DATE the hearing was adjourned due to the failure to appear of CARDINAL of the parties ' legal counsel .
CARDINAL . After a hearing on DATE , the court decided to send a rogatory letter to ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) for questioning of CARDINAL of the parties . The proceedings were stayed until its execution .
CARDINAL . On DATE the proceedings were resumed . The court scheduled the next hearing for DATE due to examination of CARDINAL of the parties ' appeal of an injunction order .
CARDINAL . On DATE the hearing did not take place due to some of the parties ' failure to appear .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG accepted some of the parties ' renunciation of their claims , transferred the rest of the claims for consideration to ORG and discontinued the proceedings .
CARDINAL . After QUANTITY hearings , on DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings , including the part concerning the applicant 's flat .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG overturned the above decision of on appeal and ordered a new examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE president of ORG brought an extraordinary appeal ( протест в порядке надзора ) against ORG decisions of CARDINAL DATE and DATE . It is not clear from the parties ' submissions when the higher court called up the case for examination of the extraordinary appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Presidium of ORG quashed the impugned decisions by way of supervisory review for errors in application of the procedural law and remitted the matter for fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG admitted the claims for new consideration and scheduled preparatory meetings with the parties .

CARDINAL . On DATE following CARDINAL of the parties ' protest against examination of the case in absence of the respondent PERSON . , ORG stayed the proceedings until PERSON . 's whereabouts could be established . In particular , the court noted that it had procured information from the post office , town administration and address bureau of the region of PERSON . 's possible residence and obtained a police report . The parties were apprised of their right to file a request with the police for PERSON . 's search .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision on appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed its decision of DATE at the parties ' request and resumed the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's claims for invalidation of the CARDINAL - way exchange transactions . It transpires from the text of the judgment that PERSON . , whose whereabouts were still unknown , was represented by legal counsel appointed by the court in accordance with LAW . The applicant appealed the judgment but did not inform the ORG about the outcome of her appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Justice of Peace of Court Circuit No . CARDINAL of GPE of LOC dismissed the applicant 's claim for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damages allegedly resulting from delayed payment of the guardian 's allowance to her .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE upheld the judgment of DATE on appeal .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provided that in case of unknown whereabouts of a respondent party the court should begin examination of the case upon receipt of the summons with a note testifying that it had been viewed by the housing authority or local council of people 's deputies at the respondent 's place of residence . It further provided that the court should put a missing respondent on the wanted list if the dispute concerned alimony , health damages and damages resulting from the loss of the main provider , and was entitled to do so in disputes brought by ORG or public agencies .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL.CARDINAL provided that the court was entitled to stay the proceedings if the respondent had been put on the wanted list in accordance with LAW .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provided that the proceedings that were stayed in accordance with LAW should be resumed upon establishing the respondent 's whereabouts .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that the court should appoint legal counsel to represent a respondent with an unknown place of residence and in other cases envisaged by the federal law .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL provides that court proceedings should be resumed upon clearance of the factors impeding continuation of the proceedings , by way of the parties ' request or court 's own initiative .
